tipiclass.name: swingcomponent
tipiclass.description: Standard getters and setters for swing based components.

value.name: background
value.description: Sets the background color for swing components. May be ignored, depending on the Look And Feel.\\ For more info about look and feel, check: [[concepts:swing:lnf|Look and Feel in Swing]]\\

value.name: foreground
value.description: Sets the background color for swing components. May be ignored, depending on the Look And Feel.\\ For more info about look and feel, check: [[concepts:swing:lnf|Look and Feel in Swing]]\\

value.name: border
value.description: Sets a swing border around this component. May be ignored, depending on the Look And Feel.\\ For more info about look and feel, check: [[concepts:swing:borders|Look and Feel in Swing]]\\

value.name: tooltip
value.description: Sets a pop up tooltip for component. May be ignored, depending on the Look And Feel.\\

value.name: visible
value.description: Allows for hiding swing components without disposing them. All components are visible by default.

tipiclass.name: dragdrop
tipiclass.description: For more info about drag an drop, check: [[concepts:swing:dragdrop|Drag and Drop in Swing]]\\

event.name: onDrag
event.description: Called when a drag is started. This is your opportunity to set the dragValue attribute of this component. If, after this event terminates, the dragValue is still null, the drag will fail.\\ You can use this to do a dynamic check whether dragging is possible at this moment. \\ For more info, check: [[concepts:swing:dragdrop|Drag and Drop in Swing]]\\

event.name: onDrop
event.description: This event gets fired when a object with a matching category has been dropped on this component. FIXME: Add a category parameter, to indicate which category matched.

value.name: dragValue
value.description: The actual value to be transported. Remember that no onDrag events will be fired as long as this attribute is null.

value.name: dragCategory
value.description: Use this to add a list of strings as categories. When the user drags, all categories will be associated with this drag, and when it is dropped, Tipi will try to match it with a dropCategory.\\ __Having no dragCategories will disable drags from this component__

value.name: dropCategory
value.description: This lists all possible categories it will accept when the user drops.

tipiclass.name: swingbutton
tipiclass.description: Standard getters and setters for swing based components.

event.name: onActionPerformed
event.description: Fired when the button/menuitem/etc gets clicked. The exact moment depends on the item, the platform, and even the Look and Feel.

method.name: fireAction
method.description: Programmatically fires the 'onActionPerformed' event. You can use this to reduce code duplication. If for example, you want to link the onActionPerformed event of this button also to another event, just call a fireAction method from there.

tipiaction.name: askValue
tipiaction.description: Request a string value of the user, using a dialog.

param.name: text
param.description: The question text in the dialog

param.name: value
param.description: The name of the global property to store the result in. For example, if I supply 'myvalue' here I could retrieve it with {global:/myvalue}

param.name: initialValue
param.description: The dialog will be pre-filled with this string.

tipiaction.name: saveValue
tipiaction.description: Opens a file save dialog and saves the value.\\ Either the value is a binary (which will be saved as such) or the value will be considered a string.

tipiaction.name: dumpCache
tipiaction.description: Dumps the jnlp cached muffins to stderr

tipiaction.name: browseBinary
tipiaction.description: Open a file load dialog, and put the selected value (as a binary) in the supplied property

tipiaction.name: openBrowser
tipiaction.description: Open a native browser with the supplied url.

tipiaction.name: playSound
tipiaction.description: Plays a sound, streamed from the supplied url. The supported types depend on the platform.

tipiaction.name: openBinary
tipiaction.description: Attempt to 'open' the binary (similar to double clicking it in the Explorer/Finder etc.)\\ The file will probably be residing in the temp directory with an unknown extension.\\ Most platform will prefer some known extensions, you can try to explicitly add the extension\\ (if you know the type of your binary.)\\

tipiaction.name: requestFocus
tipiaction.description: Request the focus. I don't think it works well

tipiaction.name: showQuestion
tipiaction.description: Show a yes/no style question dialog. If the user clicks no, the action will fire an 'TipiBreakException' and will not continue.

event.name: onYes
event.description: Fired when the answer to the question is yes.

event.name: onNo
event.description: Fired when the answer to the question is no.

tipiclass.name: column
tipiclass.description: Deprecated, don't use, use a panel with a verticalboxlayout instead

tipiclass.name: row
tipiclass.description: Deprecated, don't use, use a panel with a horizontal box layout instead

tipiclass.name: switchpanel
tipiclass.description: The switchpanel allows you to add multiple components to it. Only one component will be visible at the time It uses the Swing CardLayout, and you can compare it to a tabpane without the visible tabs.\\ You can switch between the tabs by setting the selectedId attribute

value.name: selectedId
value.description: Set the selected tab based on a string. The string can be supplied by adding a constraint when adding the child.

tipiclass.name: error
tipiclass.description: This component is not used in its current form

tipiclass.name: tipitable
tipiclass.description: A versatile component for displaying arraymessages in a table. At the moment this is the only component using a custom component loader. Add column tags to display columns. For more info: [[tipidoc:core:types:date|date]]

event.name: onActionPerformed
event.description: Fired when a table row is double clicked

event.name: onSelectionChanged
event.description: Fired when a table row is selected or deselected. Use the selectedMessage and selectedIndex to check.

event.name: onRowLoad
event.description: Fired when a table row loaded, this means that this event is fired for each and every row, BEFORE the onLoad. Here you can fiddle with the data. You can call a 'break' to stop processing the events for this injection.

event.name: onValueChanged
event.description: Fired when any value has been changed in the table. Use the event parameters to filter the exact changes you are interested in. NOTE THIS IS INCONSISTENT with java code

event.name: onReportFinished
event.description: Fired when a generic BIRT report is finished. Use the binary event parameter to serve it to the user (or something)

event.name: onKey
event.description: Recorded a keystroke. Use the parameters to determine if it is the keystroke you are looking for.

event.name: onEnter
event.description: Fired on enter. Slightly deprecated, I prefer onKey with a condition.

value.name: highColor
value.description: The light color of the zebra

value.name: lowColor
value.description: The dark color of the zebra

value.name: selectedColor
value.description: The color of a selected row

value.name: selectedIndex
value.description: The selected row of the table, or -1 if no row has been selected.\\ You can both get and set this value.

value.name: filtersvisible
value.description: Set/get whether the filter header is shown (allowing client side filtering)

value.name: columnsvisible
value.description: Set/get whether the select column button is visible.\\ If this button is visible, the user can choose which columns are visible, and in which order.

value.name: headervisible
value.description: Set/get whether the select column header buttons are visible.\\ If visible, the user can click the column headers to do client side sorting.

value.name: ignoreList
value.description: List the columns that will not be visible, even in the column selection dialog

method.name: showEditDialog
method.description: Shows a dialog depicting a single row of the table, using regular property components.

method.name: selectByValue
method.description: Select the rows with the following condition: Property named propertyName has the supplied value

method.name: updateConditionalRemarks
method.description: Refreshes the conditional remarks.

method.name: stopCellEditing
method.description: Forces editing to commit its current value.

method.name: selectNext
method.description: Next row.

method.name: selectPrevious
method.description: Previous row.

method.name: selectFirst
method.description: First row.

method.name: selectLast
method.description: First row.

method.name: fireAction
method.description: Programmatically fire an 'onActionPerformed', effectively the same as a double click

method.name: saveColumns
method.description: Save the column configuration to the supplied path. Note that the actual storage implementation depends on the tipi-storage manager.

method.name: loadColumns
method.description: Load the column configuration from the supplied path. Note that the actual storage implementation depends on the tipi-storage manager.

method.name: print
method.description: Not used.

method.name: export
method.description: Export as CSV (or another separator)

method.name: printpreview
method.description: Not used.

method.name: setAllSelected
method.description: Select all rows with the following condition: Property named propertyName has the supplied value

method.name: doSaveColumns
method.description: Save the columns to the present path

method.name: doChooseColumns
method.description: Opens the column selection dialog.

method.name: doRunReport
method.description: Initiates a BIRT report run, and returns immediately. onReportFinished will fire when the run is finished

method.name: editCell
method.description: Programmatically start editing a specific cell. Supply the property you want to edit

method.name: sort
method.description: Sort the table on the supplied index

method.name: selectMessages
method.description: Select all messages in the supplied list (.. of messages)

tipiclass.name: tipimegatable
tipiclass.description: The mega table is an n-dimensional data grid. It has a custom component loader, defining the layers.

method.name: stopCellEditing
method.description: Forces any editing table to commit its current value.

tipiclass.name: tipiquestion
tipiclass.description: Part of the question framework. In need of refactoring

tipiclass.name: tipiquestiongroup
tipiclass.description: Part of the question framework. In need of refactoring

tipiclass.name: tipiscrollquestiongroup
tipiclass.description: Part of the question framework. In need of refactoring

tipiclass.name: tipiquestionlist
tipiclass.description: Part of the question framework. In need of refactoring

tipiclass.name: tipitabbedquestionlist
tipiclass.description: Part of the question framework. In need of refactoring

tipiclass.name: tipi
tipiclass.description: Deprecated, use panel instead. They use the same java class

tipiclass.name: arraypanel
tipiclass.description: Based on the panel. Added messagePath and some events

tipiclass.name: messagepanel
tipiclass.description: Based on the panel

tipiclass.name: offsetpanel
tipiclass.description: This component is used to so 'shifting transitions.\\ It behaves like a scroll panel without the visible scroll controls.

tipiclass.name: window
tipiclass.description: Internal window (uses JInternalFrame), should only be placed onto desktops.\\ Internally uses a borderlayout as default.\\ FIXME: Check if it supports a border

tipiclass.name: undecoratedwindow
tipiclass.description: The undecorated window behaves like a regular window (JInternalFrame) only without the normal window controls. Useful for transparent controls

value.name: x
value.description: X position of the window

value.name: y
value.description: Y position of the window

value.name: h
value.description: Height of the window

value.name: w
value.description: Width of the window

tipiclass.name: screen
tipiclass.description: This component is used as 'virtual toplevel' although multiple frames are not supported yet. You never need to instantiate or access this component.

tipiclass.name: desktop
tipiclass.description: This component corresponds to the 'JDesktop' class in Swing. It is a parent for free floating children, typically windows or undecorated windows. You can place windows in other components, but take care when it uses a layoutmanager, which will cause the windows to behave a bit oddly.

value.name: borderVisible
value.description: Indicates if the border will be drawn (default true). Setting it to false, will put the button in 'toolbar style'

tipiclass.name: dropbutton
tipiclass.description: This component allows you to drop files or URL's onto it. How and when this exactly works is platform dependent.

event.name: onBinaryDropped
event.description: Fired when a binary has been dropped. //Note: This button does not allow 'regular' tipi drops. You can use regular tipi drags, though.//

tipi-parser.name: font
tipi-parser.description: Een font zit ZO in elkaar bla-bla-bla: For example: {font:/serif-1-1}
